intro: Eriosyce camanaensis, commonly known as the Camaná humpcactus, is a species of cactus native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in dense, white spines. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in the axils of the spines. Eriosyce camanaensis is a slow-growing plant that is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance.
